item.title: After Four Shark Attacks in 48 Hours, Australia Shuts Dozens of Beaches
item.description: Many of the closed beaches were in Sydney, the site of three of the attacks.
item.dc:creator: Laura Chung

media:content.media:credit: Jeremy Piper/Reuters
media:content.media:description: A lifeguard attempting to locate a shark that attacked a surfer in Sydney on Monday.

item.title: Qué significa transcend
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 299 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Soy el secretario general del Consejo de Europa. Esto es algo que pensé que nunca tendría que escribir
item.description: El derecho internacional es universal o carece de sentido. Groenlandia demostrará cuál de estas dos alternativas elegimos.
item.dc:creator: Alain Berset

media:content.media:credit: Damon Winter/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El consulado de Estados Unidos en Nuuk, Groenlandia

item.title: Word of the Day: transcend
item.description: This word has appeared in 299 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: The Chinese Island Where Dreams of Real Estate Glory Never Die
item.description: Intended as China’s version of Dubai’s palm-shaped artificial island, Ocean Flower Island is a $12 billion monument to debt-fueled economic excess.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Higgins and Gilles Sabrié

item.description: At what was planned to be Ocean Flower Island’s “wedding manor,” tourists now watch a 10-minute light show that’s projected on seven fake churches.

item.title: Corrections: Jan. 20, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Tuesday, Jan. 20, 2026.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Starmer Decries U.S. Threat Of Tariff War Over Greenland
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, January 20, 2025.

item.title: Estos fueron los mensajes entre Trump y el primer ministro de Noruega sobre Groenlandia
item.description: En el intercambio del domingo, el líder noruego trató de “frenar la escalada” del creciente conflicto sobre Groenlandia y la última amenaza arancelaria de Trump.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Gettleman

media:content.media:credit: Hannah McKay/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Trump le envió un mensaje de texto a Jonas Gahr Store, líder de Noruega, en el que reprochaba a su país que no le concediera el Premio Nobel de la Paz.

item.title: Trump Issues M.L.K. Day Proclamation After Criticism
item.description: Civil rights groups had criticized President Trump for failing to issue a proclamation honoring Martin Luther King Jr. and not attending commemorative events.
item.dc:creator: Francesca Regalado
item.category: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People

media:content.media:credit: Allison Robbert for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump at the College Football Championship in Miami on Monday.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Jan. 20, 2026
item.description: A debut by Jonathan Raksin? Sounds great!
item.dc:creator: Jo Firestone

media:content.media:credit: Bruce Bennett — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: No judgment here, we promise.

item.description: The sprawling Ocean Flower Island project in Hainan, China, features a mall, a conference center, high-rise apartments and a hotel surrounded by dozens of unfinished villas.

item.title: Death Toll Rises in Guatemalan Gang Riots
item.description: Uprisings in three prisons have killed 10 police officers, presenting another challenge for President Bernardo Arévalo in his fight against corruption and organized crime.
item.dc:creator: Jody García, James Wagner and Daniele Volpe

media:content.media:credit: Daniele Volpe for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A ceremony to honor eight police officers who died in attacks by gang members the day before, on Monday in Guatemala City.

item.title: Map: 4.9-Magnitude Earthquake Shakes Southern California
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.
item.dc:creator: William B. Davis, Madison Dong, Judson Jones, John Keefe, Joey K. Lee and Bea Malsky

media:content.media:credit: The New York Times

item.title: How Trump Is Remaking America — State by State
item.description: Change is everywhere, manifestations of the sharp right turn that the president has promised for the country.

media:content.media:credit: Vincent Alban/The New York Times

item.title: Snowstorm Causes 100-Vehicle Pileup in Michigan
item.description: More than 100 vehicles slipped and crashed into one another in a chain-reaction pileup on a Michigan interstate on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna

item.title: A City on Edge: Protesters Clash in Minneapolis
item.description: Jake Lang, a prominent right-wing activist, held a small pro-ICE rally in Minneapolis on Saturday. Within minutes, counterprotesters closed in and the confrontation turned violent.
item.dc:creator: Michael Anthony Adams, Ben Garvin and Axel Boada

media:content.media:credit: Ben Garvin for The New York Times

item.title: Trump Administration Asks Judge to Reject Minnesota’s Call to Block ICE Surge
item.description: Lawyers for the state and the cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul have sued over the deployment of some 3,000 federal agents to Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The federal operation in Minnesota has led to more than 3,000 arrests, repeated clashes with protesters and two shootings.

item.title: Judge Allows Policy Restricting Lawmakers’ Access to ICE Facilities
item.description: The decision permitted the Trump administration to continue restricting inspections of the conditions inside immigration detention compounds.
item.dc:creator: Zach Montague

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Delia Ramirez, Democrat of Illinois, during an unannounced oversight visit to the Broadview Processing Center in Broadview, Ill., last June.

item.title: Treatment for Transgender Teens in Colorado Begin to Disappear Under Trump
item.description: The Trump administration has used an array of pressure tactics to try to end treatments for minors, even in states that want to keep them.
item.dc:creator: Amy Harmon and Adam Perez

media:content.media:credit: Adam Perez for The New York Times

item.title: Before Trump, Greensboro, Vermont Was a Foodie Mecca for Canadians
item.description: Greensboro’s economy depended on friendly relations with Canada. But after tariffs and threats to make the country the “51st state,” neighborly ties have frayed.
item.dc:creator: Jenna Russell and Lily Landes

media:content.media:description: Willey’s Store has long attracted customers from Canada.

item.title: Cubans in Florida Are Being Deported in Record Numbers
item.description: Cubans had long benefited from legal privileges unavailable to immigrants from other countries. President Trump has changed that.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Mazzei

media:content.media:credit: Alfonso Duran for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Some Floridians worry that these deportations could stain the state’s proud Cuban identity.

item.title: How Trump Made Life Difficult for International Students and Wisconsin
item.description: Last fall, the number of new international undergraduates fell by 25 percent compared to the previous year. That drop poses financial and competitive challenges.
item.dc:creator: Amy Qin and Jamie Kelter Davis

media:content.media:description: The University of Wisconsin-Madison has around 8,000 students, 15 percent of its enrollment, that are from abroad.

item.title: At a Seattle Port Rocked by Tariffs, There Were 70 Jobs for 600 Workers
item.description: Dock workers are used to uncertainty, but nothing since the Great Recession of 2008 compares to what they have experienced this year.
item.dc:creator: Anna Griffin and Ruth Fremson

media:content.media:description: Since August, the monthly drop in traffic has been in the double digits compared to 2024. There was no pre-Christmas rush.

item.title: Sister Norma Pimentel’s Shelter in McAllen, Texas Looks Different Now
item.description: Sister Pimentel’s shelter in McAllen, one of the poorest cities in America, pivoted to feed the hungry.
item.dc:creator: Edgar Sandoval and Gabriel V. Cárdenas

media:content.media:description: “We have not seen a single migrant in months,” Sister Norma Pimentel said last month. “We are completely empty.”

item.title: Middle Tennessee State University Dean Laura Sosh-Lightsy Fired For Charlie Kirk Comments
item.description: Laura Sosh-Lightsy’s punishment reflects the new power dynamics in the free-speech debate, especially in red states.
item.dc:creator: Emily Cochrane

media:content.media:credit: Landon Edwards for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Laura Sosh-Lightsy was fired from her job as a dean at Middle Tennessee State University after posting on Facebook.

item.title: Columbia University Protest Culture Is Tame Even in Anti-Trump New York
item.description: The Trump administration has pushed universities all over the country to act against student protesters.
item.dc:creator: Sharon Otterman and Marco Postigo Storel

media:content.media:description: Columbia was President Trump’s first high-profile university target, followed by Harvard, Brown, Northwestern and others

item.title: Twin Falls, Idaho Has New Residents: 37 Afrikaners
item.description: Twin Falls and its dairy industry have benefited from an influx of refugees from places like Bosnia, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Myanmar. That era is over.
item.dc:creator: Miriam Jordan and Loren Elliott

media:content.media:description: A service in Swahili at Twin Falls Church of the Nazarene.

item.title: Trump’s Cuts to the C.D.C. Also Hurt Atlanta
item.description: The earnest government disease fighter had become a kind of city archetype, alongside aspiring rappers and C-suite strivers. Now scientists are leaving.
item.dc:creator: Richard Fausset
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media:content.media:credit: Dustin Chambers for The New York Times

item.title: At Yosemite National Park, Staffing Cuts Mean Visitors Have Gone Wild
item.description: After the Trump administration’s cuts, workers at the national park are spread too thin to stop people from littering, flying drones and cliff-diving.
item.dc:creator: Soumya Karlamangla and Angus Morton

media:content.media:credit: Angus Morton for The New York Times

item.title: Nome, Alaska Is Now Key to Trump’s Global Ambitions
item.description: Nome, population 3,700, is accessible only by plane outside a few months when boats can pass through. But it will be the home of the nation’s only deepwater Arctic port.
item.dc:creator: Anna Griffin and Ruth Fremson
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Nome’s existing dock will be turned into the country’s first deepwater Arctic port.

item.title: Pastor Travis Johnson Credits Trump for Reviving Evangelicalism
item.description: The president has given a new class of evangelists direct access to the White House. In return, many support him without question.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Graham and Vincent Alban

media:content.media:description: Travis Johnson sees signs everywhere that the country is better off today than it was when President Trump took office a year ago.

item.title: Indiana Judge and His Wife Are Shot at Their Suburban Home
item.description: The police in Lafayette, Ind., said they were investigating the nonfatal shootings of a Tippecanoe County Superior Court judge and his wife on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Saul

media:content.media:credit: Ron Wilkins/Journal & Courier, via Imagn
media:content.media:description: Police officers outside the home of Judge Steven Meyer and his wife, Kim, in Lafayette, Ind., on Sunday.

item.title: Valentino: una vida en fotos
item.description: Valentino Garavani, el “último emperador” de la moda, creía en el poder de la belleza.

media:content.media:description: Valentino Garavani, Roma, 1959

item.title: Wintry Weather Leads to 100-Vehicle Pileup on Interstate in Michigan
item.description: Cars and trucks slid into one another and off a highway after a lake-effect snowstorm. Numerous injuries were reported, but no deaths.
item.dc:creator: Adeel Hassan

item.title: Community Patrols Mobilize Amid ICE Operations in Minnesota
item.description: In parts of Minnesota, volunteers have organized neighborhood patrols and rapid‑response networks to monitor the actions of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement operations in the area.
item.dc:creator: Meg Felling

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

item.title: A Smaller Version of the Sphere in Las Vegas Is Planned for Maryland
item.description: Gov. Wes Moore and the company behind the Sphere said the project in National Harbor, in the Washington metro area, would create jobs and become a landmark attraction.
item.dc:creator: Christine Hauser

media:content.media:credit: Sphere Entertainment and Peterson Companies
media:content.media:description: A rendering for the entertainment center planned for the National Harbor in Maryland.

item.title: Taxing the Ultrarich
item.description: The number of billionaires has exploded, yet they often pay taxes at rates well below average.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:credit: Mike Kai Chen for The New York Times

item.title: Fire at Pakistani Mall Leaves Over 20 Dead
item.description: A fire tore through one of the busiest wholesale markets in downtown Karachi, Pakistan, over the weekend, leaving over 20 dead and dozens still missing on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna

media:content.media:credit: Akhtar Soomro/Reuters
media:content.media:description: The ruins of the Gul Plaza Shopping Mall in Karachi, Pakistan, on Monday. The source of the blaze during a busy weekend was unconfirmed.

item.title: How 40 People Died In a Train Crash in Andalucia, Spain
item.description: The victims of Spain’s deadliest rail crash in more than a decade included a police officer, journalists and a family returning from a musical.
item.dc:creator: Jason Horowitz, José Bautista and Samuel Granados

media:content.media:credit: Finbarr O'Reilly for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Emergency officials at the scene of the crash on Monday.

item.title: U.S. Tells Judge It Will Appeal ICE Restrictions in Minneapolis
item.description: Justice Department lawyers said they would ask an appellate court to review an injunction that imposes limits on the tactics used by immigration agents.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Federal agents and demonstrators outside a federal building near Minneapolis earlier this month.

item.title: Gaza’s Board of Peace: What to Know
item.description: Numerous countries say they have been invited to join President Trump’s newly minted organization, which critics say could undermine the United Nations.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Boxerman and Isabel Kershner

media:content.media:credit: Saher Alghorra for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Gaza City in December.

media:content.media:credit: Finbarr O'Reilly/The New York Times

item.title: Northern Lights Could Be Visible Across Much of the U.S. Tonight
item.description: A severe solar storm could produce a visible show from Alabama to Northern California.
item.dc:creator: Nazaneen Ghaffar

media:content.media:credit: Charlie Riedel/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: The northern lights, seen from Valley Falls, Kan., in November.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Says He Will Pass Budget Without a Vote
item.description: Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu’s effort to force the measure through Parliament opened up his government to a vote of no confidence.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Porter and Ségolène Le Stradic

media:content.media:credit: Sarah Meyssonnier/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu in the National Assembly in Paris on Wednesday.

item.title: Trump tiene una salida simple en Groenlandia, pero no parece quererla
item.description: El presidente de EE. UU. ha dejado claro que no está interesado en alcanzar acuerdos diplomáticos que seguramente lograrían sus objetivos declarados de defensa en el Ártico.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger

media:content.media:credit: Allison Robbert para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Para el presidente Trump, parte del atractivo está en el tamaño del territorio de Groenlandia: es aproximadamente tres veces el tamaño de Texas y más grande que Alaska.

item.title: Protest at Minnesota Church Service Adds to Tensions Over ICE Tactics
item.description: The Justice Department said it would investigate the protest over a pastor’s apparent role in immigration enforcement in the state.
item.dc:creator: Lauren McCarthy, Maia Coleman and Emily Cochrane

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Demonstrators outside the Bishop Henry Whipple Federal Building near Minneapolis on Sunday.

item.title: Guatemala declara el estado de sitio para enfrentar la violencia de las pandillas
item.description: En los últimos días han aumentado los disturbios en el país, como revueltas en prisiones y el asesinato de agentes de policía, que las autoridades han atribuido a las pandillas.
item.dc:creator: Yan Zhuang

media:content.media:credit: Edwin Bercian/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Guatemalan riot police officers guard the entrance to the men’s Preventive Detention Center in Guatemala City on Sunday.

item.title: Trump Is Pushing the U.S.-Europe Alliance to the Brink Over Greenland
item.description: As President Trump tries to coerce European leaders over Greenland, they are pondering the unthinkable: Is an 80-year-old alliance doomed?
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear

media:content.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: President Trump with European leaders at the White House in August. On Saturday, Mr. Trump said he would raise tariffs on several European countries unless they let him acquire Greenland.

item.title: Valentino Garavani: A Life in Photos
item.description: Valentino Garavani, fashion’s “Last Emperor,” believed in the power of beauty.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk

media:content.media:credit: Reporters Associati & Archivi/Mondadori Portfolio, via Getty Images
